input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Playing card games has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Smoking has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Diabetes has a direct effect on lifespan. Smoking is unobserved. Method 1: We look at how playing card games correlates with lifespan case by case according to diabetes. Method 2: We look directly at how playing card games correlates with lifespan in general. To understand how playing card games affects lifespan, is it more correct to use the Method 1 than Method 2?
